spell.name: Acquiescence
entries: {@i With an almost lackadaisical gesture, hedonistic power utterly engulf your enemies with a haze of broken dreams and unattainable desires, leaving them distracted and ripe for the slaughter.}

Choose one creature you can see within range, they must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for the duration. While {@condition charmed} by this spell, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0.

At the end of each of its turns, and each time it takes damage, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. The target has advantage on the saving throw if it's triggered by damage. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Armour of Hatred
entries: {@i You turn your mind inwards, to the boundless hatred and vitriol that fester in your soul. Drawing upon that dark wellspring, you fashion a jagged arcane shield against your foes' powers.}

You and a number of other creatures of your choice up to your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 0) within range are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition and have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.
Additionally until the spell ends, creatures that deal damage to you or a chosen creature with spells or other magical effects take psychic damage equal to your spellcasting modifier.

spell.name: Baleful Devolution
entries: {@i With a shout, you channel transmutative forces into your adversaries, Their bodies soon devolve into horrendous new forms.}
Choose up to two creatures you can see within range, and make a ranged spell attack against them. On a hit, they take {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage.

If you roll a 20 on an attack roll, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature dies instantly unless it has legendary actions; a creature that dies in this way or is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is immediately resurrected as a {@creature Mutated Spawn|FoxfiresRandomIdeas} that is hostile to all creatures.
This spell has no effect on creatures with the Immutable Form trait.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Be–gone Thought!

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see uses an action, bonus action, reaction or legendary action

entries: You target the triggering creature, which must succeed on a Intelligence saving throw, as you attempt to interrupt it. On a failed save the triggering action, bonus action, reaction or legendary action is wasted, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and it forgets what it was trying to do until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Boon of Mutation
entries: {@i You lay your hand upon an ally, channeling the power of raw untamed magic into them until their flesh wrenches and flows.}

A willing creature you touch has their body mutated. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, on a failed save. If the creature still has at least 1 hit point it then rolls on the following table and gains the corresponding effect until the spell ends, unless otherwise stated.

rows.name: No Discernible Change
entries: {@i Although the creature's body shifts for a moment, no noticeable change appears.}
No effect occurs and the spell ends for the target.

rows.name: Spawnhood
entries: {@i The unstable magic roils inside the creature before bursting forth in several violent and horrifying changes.}
The target is permanently transformed into a {@creature Mutated Spawn|FoxfiresRandomIdeas} and the spell then ends.

The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the new form. The target assumes the hit points of its new form, and is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form. The target's gear falls to the ground.
This change can only be reverted by a {@spell Wish|PHB} spell.

rows.name: Frenzy
entries: {@i The creature is consumed with anger.}
The target may use its bonus action to make an attack whenever it takes the Attack action.

rows.name: Fragment of Immortality
entries: {@i The creature becomes able to cheat death.}
The first time the target is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it drops to 1 hit point instead.
Additionally if the target takes damage that is greater than half its hit point maximum, the target instead takes half its hit point maximum in damage.

rows.name: Strength of the Berserker
entries: {@i Power flows into the creature.}
The target gains a +3 bonus to their Strength score.  This may raise its score above 20 but not above 30.

rows.name: Arcane Occulum
entries: {@i A blood-shot eye pushes through the creature's flesh.}
The target gains advantage on their ranged attack rolls.

rows.name: Cerebral Acceleration
entries: {@i The creature's mind races with stimuli.}
The target gains a +5 bonus to their Initiative rolls.

rows.name: Bloated
entries: {@i The creature's flesh bulges out in clammy rolls.}
If the target is missing hit points, it regains all lost hit points; otherwise its hit point maximum increases by {@dice 4d4}.

rows.name: Crystalline Body
entries: {@i The creature's flesh changes to become like diamond.}

The target gains a +3 bonus to their Constitution score. This may raise its score above 20 but not above 30. The increase to its Constitution also increases its maximum hit points, the amount it increases by is also added to its current hit points.

rows.name: Shield of Force
entries: {@i The creature is surrounded by a haze of magical energy.}

The target is considered to be in half cover against ranged attacks, even if it is in the open. If the target is in cover, it is considered to be one degree more protective; for example if they are in half cover, it is considered to be three-quarters cover.

rows.name: Mechanoid
entries: {@i The creature's flesh bonds with its armour.}
If the target is wearing armour, it gains a +2 bonus to its AC but is unable to doff its armour.

rows.name: Blade of Magic
entries: {@i The creature's held weapons are infused with raw magic power.}
The target may choose a melee weapon it is holding or a natural weapon it has; they may roll the damage dice for attacks made with that weapon twice and choose the higher result.
This effect ends early if the target is no longer holding the weapon.

rows.name: Witch-eater
entries: {@i Arcane powers and their practitioners have no dominion over this creature.}
When the target succeeds a saving throw against a spell, the caster takes {@damage 4d4} psychic damage.

rows.name: Cosmic Fate
entries: {@i The creature has a touch of destiny upon them.}
Once per turn, the target may choose to make a saving throw with advantage.

rows.name: Venomous
entries: {@i The creature's very touch is toxic.}

A creature hit by a melee attack from the target must succeed a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute; the {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

rows.name: Membranous Wings
entries: {@i Leathery wings sprout from the creature's back.}
The target gains a flying speed of 45ft; clothing and armour not made to accommodate its wings might be destroyed when they manifest.

rows.name: Meteoric Charge
entries: {@i The creature charges like a steel ball.}
If the target moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} damage.

rows.name: Icy Aura
entries: {@i The creature's body exudes a deathly chill.}
A creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the target must succeed a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} cold damage.

rows.name: Mind of Metal
entries: {@i The creature's resolve is absolute.}
The target has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws and against any effect that would lower their ability scores.

rows.name: Gun Morph
entries: {@i The creature's arm forms a flesh-metal gun.}
One of the target's arms becomes a {@item +1 pistol|DMG} with infinite ammunition. The target is proficient with this weapon.

rows.name: All-consuming Hatred
entries: {@i The creature's ire seethes within.}
The target gains advantage on the first melee attack they make on each of their turns.

rows.name: Unnatural Claws
entries: {@i The creature's claws can cut through reality.}
The target's hands become claws; their unarmed strikes deal an additional {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit, and ignore both resistance & immunity to slashing damage.

rows.name: Lifetaker
entries: {@i The creature's aura ages their foes.}
When the target's melee attacks hit a creature with 25 hit points or less, the creature must succeed a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or die instantly.

rows.name: Living Blade
entries: {@i The creature's arm warps into a sharpened edge.}
One of the target's forearms becomes a +1 one-handed {@filter melee weapon|items|type=melee weapon|source=phb} of their choice. The target is proficient with this weapon.

rows.name: Unflinching
entries: {@i The creature feels fear no longer.}
The target becomes immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

rows.name: Temporal Distortion
entries: {@i Time is slightly altered around the creature.}
The target gains an extra 15 feet of movement speed and advantage on dexterity checks and saving throws.

rows.name: Masochism
entries: {@i The creature has acquired a taste for agony.}
Each time the target takes damage, it gains temporary hit points equal to the damage taken.

rows.name: Multiple Boons
entries: {@i The creature develops several distinct mutations.}
Roll another {@dice d3 + 1} times on this table, re-rolling {@i Spawnhood} and {@i Dark Apotheosis} results.

rows.name: Dark Apotheosis
entries: {@i The creature is reborn anew, its appearance a twisted caricature of its former self.}

The target's creature type becomes monstrosity, it can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, and dim light to a distance of 120 feet; and its Strength, Dexterity and Constitution scores increase by 2, as do its maximums for those scores.
The target also gains three mutations of its choice from this table, other than {@i Spawnhood}, {@i Multiple Boons} and {@i Dark Apotheosis}.
All of the above changes are permanent and can only be reverted by a {@spell Wish|PHB} spell.
Unless the effect is permanent, when the spell ends the creature makes a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, on a failed save.

spell.name: Breath of Chaos
entries: {@i You take a deep breath, sucking in the negative energies of the battlefield and then exhale them in a great mutagenic cloud that leaves your victim's bodies running like wax.}

Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 2d8 + 1d6} damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. Choose one of the {@dice d8}s. The number rolled on that die determines the spell's damage type, as shown below.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, each target takes {@damage 1d6} extra damage of the type rolled for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cacophonic Choir
entries: {@i You breathe in magical power before emitting an ear-piercing chorus of screams that tortures the souls of all enemies nearby with a symphony of undiluted pain that shatters sanity in an instant.}

When you cast this spell each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d12} thunder damage, suffer a {@variantrule madness|DMG|short-term madness effect} and have their speed reduced to 0 for the duration. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage, doesn't suffer a {@variantrule madness|DMG|short-term madness effect} and doesn't have its speed reduced.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell and the {@variantrule madness|DMG|short-term madness effect} end for it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Chaotic Fire Storm
entries: {@i You conjure a storm of pink and blue fire upon your foes.}

Choose a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 9d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If the initial damage from this spell reduces a creature to 0 hit points, they die and explode in more flames which deal an additional {@damage 3d4} fire damage to any creatures within 5 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Conceal/Reveal
entries: {@i You seize command of the darkness around you, concealing yourself from your enemy's gaze or revealing those enemies who skulk in the shadows.}
When you cast this spell choose one of the following effects, it lasts until the spell ends:

entries.name: Conceal
entries: Creatures have disadvantage on perception checks made to detect you for the duration.

Additionally you are considered to be in half cover against ranged attacks even if you are in the open. If you are in cover, it is considered to be one degree more protective; for example if you are in half cover, it is considered to be three-quarters cover.

entries.name: Reveal
entries: Choose one creature within 60 feet of you. It must succeed a Wisdom saving throw.
On a failed save creatures have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to detect it for the duration.
Additionally if the creature is in cover, it is considered to be one degree less protective against ranged attacks; for example if its in half cover, it is considered to be in the open instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Delirium
entries: {@i You pry apart the mind of a creature, tearing into and fraying its sanity like a child's plaything.}

Choose one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 3d12} psychic damage and suffer a {@variantrule madness|DMG|long-term madness effect}. On a successful save they take half as much psychic damage and don't suffer a  {@variantrule madness|DMG|long-term madness effect}.
When the spell ends, the {@variantrule madness|DMG|long-term madness effect} ends for that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Destructor/Renewer
entries: {@i Caging a portion of your magical might you send forth waves of energy to destroy your enemies in a burst of azure flame – or, if the need arises, heal the wounds of your allies.}
When you cast this spell choose one of the following effects:

entries.name: Destructor
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage on a failed save and starts burning.

The burning target sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

entries.name: Renewer
entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you regains {@dice 1d6} hit points. This effect of the spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage or healing increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Detest Magic

time.condition: which you take when you are forced to make a saving throw by a spell or other magical effect

entries: {@i Summoning raw disgust you undo the machinations of an enemy caster.}

You gain advantage on the triggering saving throw. Until the start of your next turn, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and you have resistance to damage from spells.

spell.name: Doom
entries: {@i With a simple manipulation of that which is to come, you grant a darkened fate to a chosen foe. While this shadow rests upon the enemy's soul, death seeks them out above all others, each blow or shot that comes their way rendered inescapably lethal.}

Choose one creature you can see within range; they must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save all attack rolls against the target have advantage until the spell ends. Additionally any damage die rolled against the target may be re-rolled, choosing the higher of the two results. This only affects the damage dealt to the target of this spell.
The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; on a successful save the spell ends.

spell.name: Doombolt
entries: {@i You hurl a bolt of roiling energy that blasts your targets into terrifying new shapes.}

The bolt forms a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d4} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Objects and structures take double damage from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ecstatic Seizures
entries: {@i The din that rages around the battle takes on a compelling quality to your foes, and they find themselves shaking apart with ecstasy as their bodies resonate with each new sound.}

Choose one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it takes a number of {@dice d8} equal to its Strength or Dexterity modifier (whichever is higher, minimum of 1) in bludgeoning damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Eldritch Storm

m.text: a cracked clear crystal worth at least 50gp which the spell consumes

entries: {@i You summon a swirling corona of power that assails your foes with bolts of energy and magic shock waves.}
Choose a point you can see within range, a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder otherworldly storm appears centered on that point.

When the storm appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@dice 5d6} force damage on a failed save and has their movement speed reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn. On a successful save they take half as much damage and their movement speed isn't reduced. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the cylinder's radius and height both increase by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Elemental Horror
entries: {@i You conjure a hellish blast of blistering flame which rips through the air with a sound akin to screeching souls, that sears a moment of fear into anything it touches.}

The beam is a line 30 feet long, 5 feet wide and blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

Additionally a creature who takes 10 or more fire damage from this spell must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of their next turn; on a failed save they become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Embolden/Horrify
entries: {@i You call down the splendour of battle, instilling your allies with courage or sapping it from your foes.}
When you cast this spell choose one of the following effects, it lasts until the spell ends:

entries.name: Embolden
entries: Choose one willing creature you can see within range, which may include yourself.
The target is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition until the spell ends.

entries.name: Horrify
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, they must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save the target is {@condition frightened} of you and has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} until the spell ends. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A construct or an undead is immune to this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Empower/Enervate
entries: {@i You cause your comrades to strike at their full potential, imbuing them with the might of legendary heroes or diminishing the powers of your foes.}
When you cast this spell choose one of the following effects, it lasts until the spell ends:

entries.name: Empower
entries: Choose one willing creature you can see within range, which may include yourself.
The target gains a +3 bonus to its Strength score until the spell ends. This may raise its score above 20 but not above 30.

entries.name: Enervate
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw.
On a failed save the target suffers a -3 penalty to its Strength score until the spell ends. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, you may target two creatures instead of one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, you may target three creatures instead of one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you may target four creatures instead of one.

spell.name: Enhance/Drain
entries: {@i Calling upon fortune's favour, you grant battle-luck to your allies or strip it from your foes.}
When you cast this spell choose one of the following effects, it lasts until the spell ends:

entries.name: Enhance
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range.
The target gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls and a +3 bonus to initiative rolls until the spell ends.

entries.name: Drain
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, they must make a Wisdom saving throw.
On a failed save the target suffers a -1 penalty to its attack rolls and a -3 penalty to its initiative rolls until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

Additionally when you use a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bonus/penalty to attack rolls increases to +2/-2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bonus/penalty increases to +3/-3.

spell.name: Executioner
entries: {@i You summon an astral doppelganger and unleash it upon your foes. This vengeful apparition carves a path through your enemies, each kill spurring it on as it rips apart flesh in a blaze of magical energy.}
Choose one creature you can see within range, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. The target takes {@damage 5d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell you may select another target within 15 feet of the first, and within 60 feet of you, to make a Wisdom saving throw as if they were the original target of the spell.
For each target after the first the damage dealt is reduced by two damage die, from {@dice 5d8} to {@dice 3d8} for example, and the spell ends when it would deal no damage to its next target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Extract Wealth
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range. The target creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Additionally on a failed save, if the creature is carrying any currency, half the total value they carry (rounding down) flies towards you and into your pockets, bag, or other inventory space. If you have nowhere to store the currency, it instead lands at your feet. If the creature has no currency, the item with the highest exact value (in gold pieces) they possess that isn't being worn flies towards you instead, and lands at your feet.
Should the attracted currency or item not be able to reach you, such as being unable to pass through a window, it falls to the ground as close to you as it can.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Exudation of Rot
entries: {@i Gurgling foul incantations you exude a disgusting wave of soul-pox. All those nearby are covered in a layer of toxic goo so foul it can kill in seconds.}

Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 7d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.
The {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Flashbang

components.m: a piece magnesium and a pinch of sulfur

entries: Choose a point you can see within range; each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes {@damage 2d4} thunder damage, is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and {@condition incapacitated} for the duration; on a successful save the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition incapacitated}.

spell.name: Flayerstorm
entries: {@i A rust-laden tempest howls from the depths of the arcane at your command. It screams across the armour and weapons of your target, shaking them like a dog shakes a bone as it rips away great splinters and hurls them as spears into the foe.}

Choose one creature you can see within range. Roll {@dice 1d4} for each non-magical manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, the creature is holding or wearing. One of the following then occurs:

If the object is either metal armor or a metal shield, it takes a permanent and cumulative penalty to the AC it offers equal to the dice roll. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.
If the object is a metal weapon, it takes a permanent and cumulative penalty to damage rolls equal to the dice roll. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed.

For each point of penalty, the creature holding or wearing the object, or another creature within 15 feet of them and in range of the spell, takes {@damage 1d8} slashing damage. You can choose a different target for each instance of damage from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the {@dice 1d4} roll for each each non-magical manufactured metal object gains a cumulative +1 bonus for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Flickering Fire of Change
entries: {@i You twist your hands in the air and he bodies of your foes are suddenly consumed with coruscating flames.}

Choose up to {@dice 2d6} creatures you can see within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 3d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally any creature that takes damage from this spell repeats the Constitution saving throw at the start of their next turn. On a failed save the creature takes {@damage 3d10} fire damage, however on a successful save the creature gains resistance to all non-magical damage until the end of their turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, you may target {@dice 3d6} creatures instead of {@dice 2d6}. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you may target {@dice 4d6} creatures instead of {@dice 2d6}.

spell.name: Flying Sardine
entries: {@i You regurgitate a sardine and send it flying towards your target.}

Choose one creature you can see within range; they must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and be unable to speak or cast spells with verbal components until the start of their next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Fortune
entries: {@i Scrying possible futures to foresee imminent danger, you aid your allies in avoiding it. The malice of magic recoils from your incantations while projectiles pass through thin air where your allies stood but a moment before.}

Choose one creature you can see within range. Until the spell ends the target has advantage on saving throws and when they are subjected to an effect that allows them to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, they instead take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Gaze of the Crimson King
entries: {@i To fall under the monocular gaze of "The Crimson King" is to be utterly destroyed by the power of change.}

A beam of power shoots from the eye in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d12} force damage, {@damage 3d12} psychic damage and {@damage 3d12} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the creature also starts burning.

The burning creature sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. At the start of each of its turns, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can end this damage by using its action to repeat the Constitution saving throw to extinguish the flames. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.
If damage from this spell kills a creature, the creature and all of its belongings, except artifacts, are reduced to atoms.

spell.name: Gift of Contagion
entries: {@i You gather clouds of contagion and rot-flies about your enemies, granting them the blessing of decay.}
Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails it rolls on the table below and gains the corresponding effect until the spell ends.

rows.name: Flyblown Palsy
entries: The target can't use reactions. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.
Additionally the target is surrounded by buzzing flies and is considered to be in half cover against ranged attacks, even if it is in the open.

rows.name: Muscular Atrophy
entries: The target's Strength score is reduced by 3, the target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0.
Additionally the target is unable to take the dash action.

rows.name: Liquefying Ague
entries: The target's Strength and Constitution scores are reduced by 3. The target dies if this reduces its Strength or Constitution to 0. The decrease to the target's Constitution also decreases its maximum hit points, the amount it decreases by is also removed from its current hit points.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Guide
entries: {@i You twist the strands of destiny to your will, picking out targets from amidst the swirling chaos of battle and guiding the shots of your allies into the enemy where they might do the most harm.}
Choose one creature, other than yourself, you can see within range. Until the spell ends the target gains advantage on any ranged attack rolls they make.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, you may target two creatures instead of one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, you may target three creatures instead of one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, you may target four creatures instead of one.

spell.name: Heart's Desire

m.text: a ruby worth at least 50gp, which the spell consumes

entries: {@i You conjure an illusion formed from the desire of your target's heart.}
Choose one target you can see within range, they must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, an illusory creature or object (depending on the target's desire) no larger than a 20-foot cube appears within 10 feet of the target and the target becomes {@condition charmed} by the illusion for the duration. While {@condition charmed} by this spell, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 5 feet.

The illusion appears completely real, including sounds, smells, touch and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. It can't create sufficient heat or cold to cause damage, a sound loud enough to deal thunder damage or deafen a creature, or a smell that might sicken a creature (like a {@creature troglodyte||troglodyte's} stench).

At the end of each of the target's turns before the spell ends, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 5d10} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Hysterical Frenzy
entries: {@i Your chant goads your allies into a frantic frenzy of activity, driving them to ever greater acts of sensation-seeking destruction.}
Choose up to two willing creatures that you can see within range. Each creature rolls on the table below and gains the corresponding effect until the spell ends.

rows.name: Swollen Sensorium
entries: The creature gains a +5 bonus to their initiative rolls.

rows.name: Lunatic Strength
entries: The creature gains a +3 bonus to their Strength score. This may raise its score above 20 but not above 30.

rows.name: Hyperactive Fit
entries: The creature may make an additional attack as a bonus action when they take the attack action on their turn.
If a target is able to cast spells, it can't cast them or concentrate on them until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Implosion
entries: {@i You create a destructive resonance in a corporeal creature's body, causing it to collapse in on itself.}

Choose a creature you can see within range. At the start of your next turn the creature makes a Constitution saving throw. If a creature fails the save with 100 hit points or less it collapses in on itself, killing it instantly. If it has more than 100 hit points it takes {@damage 20d10} force damage; on a successful save the creature takes half as much damage instead.

spell.name: Infernal Claws
entries: {@i You call forth crackling claws that sheathe your arms in dark lightning. When you strike, your foes are blasted back as foul energy spears from their bodies.}
You conjure a claw in each free hand, each digit like a dagger blade, and they last until the spell ends. If you have no hands free, the spell fails.

Each claw counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient, that have the finesse and light properties. On a hit they deal {@dice 2d4} lightning and {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage and a creature must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both the lightning and necrotic damage increase by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Kinetic Taunt
entries: {@i You taunt another creature in an attempt to draw its aggression.}

Choose one creature you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it must use an {@action attack}, {@action cast a spell|PHB|spell}, or other ability with you as its target on its next turn. If the creature can't use any of those actions, even after moving, it instead takes the {@action dash} action to move towards you provided it is able to do so.

spell.name: Kiss of Life
entries: You touch one creature, taking {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage, that can't be reduced in any way, and imbue them with a modicum of your life force.
The creature regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage you took, rounded down. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

spell.name: Lash of Excess
entries: {@i A long tongue-like whip of energy erupts from you and slashes into the ranks of your enemies, leaving a trail of broken and convulsing corpses in its wake.}

A lash of energy 30 feet long and 5 feet wide emanates from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} slashing damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated} on a successful one.
You may roll the damage die for this spell twice and choose the higher result of the two.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Miasma of Pestilence
entries: {@i You use your gifts to surround yourself with ghastly, vomit-inducing odours that cripple all nearby foes.}
A disgusting miasma clings around you out to a distance of 10 feet for the duration.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save the creature subtracts {@dice 1d6} plus your spellcasting modifier from any attack roll, ability check or saving throw it makes while in the area. If a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, they are also {@condition incapacitated} while in the area as they retch and heave.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the spell's radius increases to a 10 feet. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the spell's radius increases to a 15 feet. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the spell's radius increases to a 20 feet.

spell.name: Mind War
entries: {@i You reach out to attack the mind of an enemy in a desperate mental duel. Foes find their thoughts invaded by the crushing presence of your mind, your inscrutable will extinguishing their thoughts with horrific ease, triggering a cascade of psychosomatic trauma.}

Choose one target you are aware of within range. The target must make an opposed check using your spellcasting ability. If you succeed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn, and takes psychic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, equal to the difference between the caster and target's rolls multiplied by five (minimum of 5).

spell.name: Paul Allen's Magic Card
entries: You hold out a small piece of card, making it appear to onlookers as impressively crafted even if in reality it is otherwise unexceptional.

Each creature within range who can see the card (other than you) must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn. This spell has no effect on creatures who are blind or who speak no languages.

spell.name: Plague Wind
entries: {@i You belch forth a foetid wind of filth that blows through your foes.}

Choose a point you can see within range, each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.
A {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Portal
entries: Choose two points on flat, solid surfaces, that you can see within range. A circular portal, up to 5 feet in diameter, opens on each point. The portals appear as glowing rings akin to door ways which you can see through normally.

If a portal would open on a space directly below a creature, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw; the creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. On a successful save, the creature moves to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of the portal.
Any creature or object entering the portal exits from the other portal as if the two were adjacent to each other.
On your turn, you can move the location of one of the portals to another valid point within range as a bonus action.
If the surface a portal is on is moved more than 5 feet, is broken or is destroyed, the portal disappears and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the maximum size of each portal increases to a 10-foot diameter. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the maximum size of each portal increases to a 15-foot diameter. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the maximum size of each portal increases to a 20-foot diameter.

spell.name: Protect/Jinx
entries: {@i Chained by runes of power, fate itself is bound to your will.}
When you cast this spell choose one of the following effects, it lasts until the spell ends:

entries.name: Protect
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, which may include yourself.
The target gains a +2 bonus to its AC and its saving throws until the spell ends.

entries.name: Jinx
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, they must make a Wisdom saving throw.
On a failed save the target suffers a -2 penalty to its AC and to its saving throws until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, you may target two creatures instead of one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, you may target three creatures instead of one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you may target four creatures instead of one.

spell.name: Quicken/Restrain
entries: {@i You twist time itself to your bidding, outlines blurring as you and your allies move like phantoms. Those cursed by your temporal manipulations find themselves moving as if through deep water.}
When you cast this spell choose one of the following effects, it lasts until the spell ends:

entries.name: Quicken
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, which may include yourself.
The target gains a bonus to its movement speed equal to half its current movement speed until the spell ends.

entries.name: Restrain
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, they must make a Wisdom saving throw.
On a failed save the target's movement speed is halved and it is unable to take the {@action Dash} action until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Quid Pro Quo
entries: {@i A favour for a favour; you scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours... }

Choose one willing creature you can see within range. The creature takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, and you regain a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage it took.

At the end of the spell's duration you take necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, equal to the number of hit points you initially regained from this spell and the target creature regains hit points equal to that amount.
However if the original target of the spell is dead when the spell ends, you take no necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Revulsion
entries: {@i You twist the form of your target to become as unappealing to others as possible, to where few could stand to be around them for long.}
Choose one target within range, they must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, until the spell ends the target's Charisma score is reduced by 3 and they have disadvantage on all Charisma checks they make. The target is {@condition stunned} if this reduces its Charisma to 0. The target is no longer {@condition stunned} if it regains at least one point of Charisma.
Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the Charisma score reduction increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sensory Block
entries: {@i An excellent escape for those dialectically challenged mages and critically sensitive creatives alike; unfortunately, as much as they might try, the spell can't last forever.}

Choose one creature you can see within range; the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature can't see or hear you (or anything you are wearing or carrying) and is unable to target you with attacks, spells or other actions for the duration.

However you are likewise unable to see or hear the target creature (or anything it is wearing or carrying) and are unable to target the creature with attacks, spells or other actions for the duration.
Additionally if you cause any damage to the target creature (or vice versa) during the spell's duration, the spell ends early.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of a higher level, the duration increases to 8 hours with a 3rd-level slot, to 1 day with a 5th-level slot, to 30 days with an 7th-level slot, and to a year and a day with a 9th-level spell slot.

spell.name: Sensory Overload
entries: {@i You reach out to overload the nerve centres of your foes.}

Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target takes {@damage 3d4} psychic damage, is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} and {@condition stunned}. On a successful save the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} or {@condition stunned}.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Siphon Magic
entries: {@i Opening your arms wide you embrace the invisible gales of arcane force that rage through the world. By chanting esoteric litanies backwards, you can steal the power of other magical emanations and use them to bolster your own.}

Until the spell ends, whenever a creature other than you casts a spell of 1st level or higher within the spell's radius, you can use your reaction to make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level.
On a success you regain an expended spell slot of a level equal to half the triggering spell's level (rounded down, minimum of 1).

spell.name: Stream of Corruption
entries: {@i Your maw distends wide before spewing forth a noxious stream of disease and filth that chokes and suffocates your foes.}

Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes {@damage 6d4} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.
The {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Symphony of Pain
entries: {@i Opening your mouth unnaturally wide, you shriek and emit a barrage of raw arcane energy that rages around your foes.}

Choose two targets you can see within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, until the spell ends the target has a penalty to any attack roll it makes equal to your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1) and it has vulnerability to thunder damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Treason of Change
entries: {@i You whisper into the minds of your enemies, turning brother against brother before the pall of confusion dissipates and leaves your victims staring in horror at the treachery they have wrought.}

Up to three hostile creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Wisdom saving throws. On a failed save a target must immediately use their reaction to make a melee, ranged or spell attack of your choice against a target you choose. Additionally, whether the target of the spell makes an attack or not, they are {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wave of Insanity
entries: You unleash a rolling wave of madness that grips the minds of targets within range. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 1d6} psychic damage and suffering a {@variantrule madness|DMG|short-term madness effect} on a failed save.

A creature affected by this spell makes another Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, or when the spell ends, the {@variantrule madness|DMG|short-term madness effect} ends for it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Weapon Virus
entries: {@i You infest your foe's weaponry with viral decay.}

Choose a manufactured weapon that you can see within range. A foul miasma clings to the weapon and any creature who makes an attack with the weapon must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional manufactured weapon for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Will of Destiny
entries: {@i You summon forth a well of certainty and confidence, steeling your own mind against the horrors ahead. Doubt and fear are washed away from your mind, those nearby gaining grim resolve from your aura of indomitability.}

You and a number of other creatures of your choice up to your spellcasting modifier within range are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition and have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws and against any effect that would lower ability scores.
